author: Staff Reporter
text:
Members of farmers’ organisations and political parties staging a demonstration in Erode on Tuesday, assailing the move by GAIL to lay gas pipeline across agricultural fields.—PHOTO: M. GOVARTHAN

: The Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam staged a protest demonstration against the GAIL pipeline project on Tuesday.

The demonstration was held in front of the BSNL office.

The protesters demanded that the State government to appeal against the Supreme Court verdict.

They also demanded that GAIL reroute his pipeline in non-farm lands.

The farmers’ organisations also demanded scrapping of the Petroleum and Minerals Act, 1972; and enactment of a new Act that protects the rights of land owners and farmers.Farmers affiliated to all parties barring the ruling party took part in the protests here.

Salem Special Correspondent adds:

In Salem, Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam affiliated to CPI and CPI (M) staged a demonstrated in front of the Head Post Office here on Tuesday to protest against laying gas pipeline for GAIL project through agricultural lands.

P. Shanmugam, State general secretary, Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam (CPI-M), led the agitation.

District secretaries P.Thangavel (CPI-M), A. Mohan (CPI) and others spoke highlighting the demand.

They said that the execution of GAIL pipeline laying project will badly hit the farmers of Sankagiri, Morur, Kasthuripattu, Vettukadupatti, Vaikuntam, Ollakkasinnanur, Kannantheri, Puthur, Thoppur, Omalur, Muthunayakkanpatti in Salem district.

The farmers have raised mango, jackfruit trees in large numbers in these farm lands and the felling of the trees will cause heavy financial loss to them.

They demanded the government to lay the GAIL pipeline through the national highways.

The government should do away with its move of acquiring farm lands for the execution of the GAIL project.

Erode Special Correspondent adds

In Erode, members of farmers’ organisations and political parties staged a demonstration on Tuesday assailing the move by Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) to lay natural gas pipelines across agricultural fields.

The protest led by former MP of Erode A. Ganeshamoorthy of MDMK in his capacity as coordinator of the affected people’s movement witnessed speakers expressing resolve to physically prevent GAIL from laying the pipelines, in the wake of a favourable Supreme Court order. They lambasted the State Government for not having acted in time to prevent misery for 5,000 farmers in seven Western districts .
title: Farmers protest laying of GAIL gas pipeline project
